sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
A full confutation of the covenant lately sworne and subscribed by many in Scotland; delivered in a speech, at the visitation of Downe and Conner, held in Lisnegarvy the 26th. of September, 1638. Published by authority. Speech, delivered at the visitation of Downe and Conner, held in Lisnegarvy the 26th. of September, 1638 Leslie, Henry, 1580-1661.
[2], 20 [i.e. 38] p.
printed by John Raworth, for George Thomason and Octavian Pullen, and are to be sold at the Rose in St. Pauls Church-yard, London : 1639.
A reissue, with cancel title page, of: Leslie, Henry. A speech, delivered at the visitation of Downe and Conner, held in Lisnegarvy the 26th. of September, 1638. Page 38 is misnumbered 20. Reproductions of the originals in the British Library.
=======
A full confutation of the covenant lately sworne and subscribed by many in Scotland; delivered in a speech, at the visitation of Downe and Conner, held in Lisnegarvy the 26th. of September, 1638. Published by authority. Speech, delivered at the visitation of Downe and Conner, held in Lisnegarvy the 26th. of September, 1638 Leslie, Henry, 1580-1661.
[2], 20 [i.e. 38] p.
printed by John Raworth, for George Thomason and Octavian Pullen, and are to be sold at the Rose in St. Pauls Church-yard, London : 1639.
A reissue, with cancel title page, of: Leslie, Henry. A speech, delivered at the visitation of Downe and Conner, held in Lisnegarvy the 26th. of September, 1638. Page 38 is misnumbered 20. Reproductions of the originals in the British Library.
George Thomason
Octavian Pullen
John Raworth
the Rose in St. Pauls Church-yard
